Let G be a free group, and let Ri = ⟨ri⟩G be the normal closures of elements ri ∈G.
It is known (B. Hartley, Yu. Kuzmin, J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 74 (1991), 247–256) that the quotient (R1 ∩R2)/[R1, R2] is a free abelian group. On the other hand, the quotient (R1 ∩· · · ∩Rn)/[[R1, . . . , Rn]] has, in general, non-trivial torsion for n ⩾4. Is this quotient always torsion-free for n = 3? This is known to be true if r1, r2, r3 are not proper powers in G.
R. Mikhailov
